title.narrative: EISP, phase 2 Environmental Infrastructure Support Program

description.narrative: The Department for Project Management and the Ministry responsible for Environmental Protection to have the capacity and capability for coordination and implementation of EU structural funds.

EISP projektet genomförs av Company BrookHannas & Partners vilka vann en internationell konkurrensupphandling med en budget på 26 msek. Det började 2017-01 och kommer att pågår i 3 år. Målsättningen är at bistå miljöministeriet att ta fram en prioriterad projektlist Singel Project Pipeline) vilket underlättar för Serbien att göra de nödvändiga investeringarna i miljöinfrastruktur med den kvalité som EU kräver för vattenreningsverk och fytosanitära avfallsdeponier. Det bedöms att de nödvändiga investeringarna är storleksordningen 15 miljarder Euro över de kommande decennierna. En integrerad de av projektet att utbilda och träna ministeriet och till viss del även kommunerna och de kommunala bolagens personal att göra realistiska planer genom ett stegvis förfarande (projektplan, förstudier, genomarbetade studier) av uppdragsbeskrivningar.

The EISP is implemented by the Company BrookHannas & Partners which won an international bidding process with a budget of 26 msek. It started 2017-01 and will last for a three years. The project will assist the Ministry of Environmental Protection (MoEP) to plan for a Single Project Pipeline (SPP) of projects to enable Serbia to make the necessary investment in Environmental Infrastructure which qualify for EU access like Waste Water Treatment Plans (WWTP) and phytosanitary Landfills. It is estimated that the required investments are in an order of magnitude of 15 Billion Euro over the next decades. An integrated part of the project is to assist to train the MoEP staff and also to some extent also Municipalities and Public utilities to make realistic plans by having a stepwise approach (scope of studies; pre-feasibility study, feasibility study) of preparing terms of references.

tag.narrative: 12.5 - By 2030, substantially reduce waste generation through prevention, reduction, recycling and reuse.
12.5 - Till 2030 väsentligt minska mängden avfall genom åtgärder för att förebygga, minska, återanvända och återvinna avfall.

6.3 - By 2030, improve water quality by reducing pollution, eliminating dumping and minimizing release of hazardous chemicals and materials, halving the proportion of untreated wastewater and substantially increasing recycling and safe reuse globally.

6.3 - Till 2030 förbättra vattenkvaliteten genom att minska föroreningar, stoppa dumpning och minimera utsläpp av farliga kemikalier och material, halvera andelen obehandlat avloppsvatten och väsentligt öka återvinningen och en säker återanvändning globalt.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The Sida-funded Environmental Infrastructure Support Program (EISP) 2011 - 2016 focused on assisting the Department for Project Management within the Serbian Ministry responsible for Environmental Protection (The Ministry). The implementing agency IMG legal status was changed at the end of the project and it created some management difficulties and it took more than a year before the Embassy received the final audit report in 2017 and 2,8 msek, was paid back to Sida. The main focus of the program was to build the necessary capacities and capabilities within the Ministry to assist Serbia with the preparation of EU approximation related to EU Chapter 27 (Environment & Climate Change). A major challenge was shortage of expert at the Ministry as well as at the cities and municipalities. Nevertheless, the project contributing to the development of a pipeline of environmental projects and by prioritizing projects to be included in the Single Project Pipeline (SPP) for EU funding. The SPP includes priority projects for the so-called Heavy Investment Directives: Solid Waste Management and Wastewater Management. Overall there is a lack of specialized staff required in cities and municipalities to create the necessary ownership and awareness on the need to make the required investment in waste water and sanitary landfills. For some part of the society affordability of citizens to pay for environmental services is low, and therefore it is difficult to raise the tariffs. During the implementation, the responsibility for the environment portfolio was three times transferred to a different Ministry, with significant impact on the capacity building. An environmental project pipeline was created according to strategic objectives. To determine these objectives, the project provided policy contributions through the revision of the national waste management strategy and the development of Directive Specific Implementation Plans (DSIP) for the Landfill Directive.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
